bug.author: huanghanmei
bug.summary: detect.py: the error of IndexError: list index out of range
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
A clear and concise description of what the bug is. When running the detect.py, there is a IndexError but the process of training did not have <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1.File "detect.py", line 121, in detect 2. s += '%g %ss, ' % (n, names[int(c)]) # add to string 3. IndexError: list index out of range 4. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. Desktop (please complete the following information):
OS: [e.g. iOS] Version [e.g. 22]
Smartphone (please complete the following information):
Device: [e.g. iPhoneXS] OS: [e.g. iOS8.1] Version [e.g. 22]
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment: Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/huanghanmei>@huanghanmei</denchmark-link> , thank you for your interest in our work! Please visit our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data>Custom Training Tutorial</denchmark-link> to get started, and see our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb>Google Colab Notebook</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3>Docker Image</denchmark-link> , and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart>GCP Quickstart Guide</denchmark-link> for example environments. If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and minimum viable code to reproduce your issue, otherwise we can not help you.
and there is no data on the image of classification <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59170826/80083530-4c472980-8588-11ea-96c3-8d4d78a85563.png></denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/huanghanmei>@huanghanmei</denchmark-link> your error is caused because you have not passed a correct .names files to detect.py for your custom dataset: python3 detect.py --names your_names.names In your training images, you need to train much longer, the default 300 epochs.

<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59170826/80162046-c6b58f00-8604-11ea-8be2-3ed9b604272e.png></denchmark-link>
The image of 000087.jpg is from the training dataset and what happend
Thank you, i have run the detect.py successfully
This issue is stale because it has been open 30 days with no activity. Remove Stale label or comment or this will be closed in 5 days.
